faqs.question: How do I use the Custom Model Creation Panel?
faqs.answer:
### Custom Model Creation Overview
This panel provides powerful tools for merging armatures and attaching meshes, with two main modes: Armature and Mesh.

[image]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/catsblenderplugin/website/wikicurrent/custom-model.png[/image]

### Tutorial Access
A helpful tutorial button is available at the top of the panel to guide you through the process.

### Armature Mode
**Main Settings**
- Merge Same Bones: Automatically combines bones with matching names
- Apply Transforms: Applies current transformations before merging
- Join Meshes: Combines meshes after armature merging
- Remove Zero Weight Bones: Cleans up unused bones
- Cleanup Shape Keys: Optimizes shape keys during merge

**Merge Selection**
- Merge Into: Select the target armature
- To Merge: Choose which armature to merge in
- Attach to Bone: (Available when not merging same bones) Select connection point

### Mesh Mode
**Purpose**: Attach individual meshes to an existing armature

**Settings**
- Join Meshes: Option to combine meshes during attachment

**Selection Options**
- Merge Into: Choose target armature
- Attach Mesh: Select mesh to attach
- Attach to Bone: Pick the bone for attachment

[note]You need at least two armatures for Armature mode, or one armature and one mesh for Mesh mode.[/note]

### Common Use Cases
- Combining multiple character models
- Adding accessories to existing models
- Merging partial models into complete ones
- Attaching custom meshes to rigged characters

[warning]Always create a backup of your models before performing merge operations.[/warning]
